item.title: Bill add a quote by Benjamin Franklin
item.description: "It's better to swim in the sea below Than to swing in the air and feed the crow, Says jolly Ned Teach of Bristol." -- Benjamin Franklin

item.title: Bill add a quote by Michael Pollan
item.description: "He showed the words “chocolate cake” to a group of Americans and recorded their word associations. “Guilt” was the top response. If that strikes you as unexceptional, consider the response of French eaters to the same prompt: “celebration." -- Michael Pollan

item.title: Bill add a quote by Frank Herbert
item.description: "When religion and politics travel in the same cart, the riders believe nothing can stand in their way. Their movements become headlong - faster and faster and faster. They put aside all thoughts of obstacles and forget the precipice does not show itself to the man in a blind rush until it's to late." -- Frank Herbert

item.title: Bill add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "His rage passes description - the sort of rage that is only seen when rich folk that have more than they can enjoy suddenly lose something that they have long had but have never before used or wanted." -- J.R.R. Tolkien
